trans-unit.source: Application Insights for Windows desktop apps and services
trans-unit.target: Application Insights for Windows desktop apps and services

trans-unit.source: Analyze usage and performance of your Windows desktop app with Application Insights.
trans-unit.target: Analyze usage and performance of your Windows desktop app with Application Insights.

trans-unit.source: Application Insights on Windows Desktop apps, services and worker roles
trans-unit.target: Application Insights on Windows Desktop apps, services and worker roles

trans-unit.source: Application Insights is in preview.
trans-unit.target: Application Insights is in preview.

trans-unit.source: Application Insights lets you monitor your deployed application for usage and performance.
trans-unit.target: Application Insights lets you monitor your deployed application for usage and performance.

trans-unit.source: All Windows applications - including desktop apps, background services, and worker roles - can use the Application Insights core SDK to send telemetry to Application Insights.
trans-unit.target: All Windows applications - including desktop apps, background services, and worker roles - can use the Application Insights core SDK to send telemetry to Application Insights.

trans-unit.source: The core SDK just provides an API: unlike the Web or device SDKs, it doesn't include any modules that collect data automatically, so you have to write code to send your own telemetry.
trans-unit.target: The core SDK just provides an API: unlike the Web or device SDKs, it doesn't include any modules that collect data automatically, so you have to write code to send your own telemetry.

trans-unit.source: Create an Application Insights resource
trans-unit.target: Create an Application Insights resource

trans-unit.source: In the [Azure portal][portal], create a new Application Insights resource.
trans-unit.target: In the [Azure portal][portal], create a new Application Insights resource.

trans-unit.source: For application type, choose Windows Store app.
trans-unit.target: For application type, choose Windows Store app.

trans-unit.source: Click New, Application Insights
trans-unit.target: Click New, Application Insights

trans-unit.source: (Your choice of application type sets the content of the Overview blade and the properties available in [metric explorer][metrics].)
trans-unit.target: (Your choice of application type sets the content of the Overview blade and the properties available in [metric explorer][metrics].)

trans-unit.source: Take a copy of the Instrumentation Key.
trans-unit.target: Take a copy of the Instrumentation Key.

trans-unit.source: Click Properties, select the key, and press ctrl+C
trans-unit.target: Click Properties, select the key, and press ctrl+C

trans-unit.source: Install the SDK in your application
trans-unit.target: Install the SDK in your application

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, edit the NuGet packages of your desktop app project.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, edit the NuGet packages of your desktop app project.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the project and select Manage Nuget Packages
trans-unit.target: Right-click the project and select Manage Nuget Packages

trans-unit.source: Install the Application Insights Core API package.
trans-unit.target: Install the Application Insights Core API package.

trans-unit.source: Search for "Application Insights"
trans-unit.target: Search for "Application Insights"

trans-unit.source: You can install other packages such as the Performance Counter or log capture packages if you want to use their facilities.
trans-unit.target: You can install other packages such as the Performance Counter or log capture packages if you want to use their facilities.

trans-unit.source: Set your InstrumentationKey in code, for example in main().
trans-unit.target: Set your InstrumentationKey in code, for example in main().

trans-unit.source: Why isn't there an ApplicationInsights.config?
trans-unit.target: Why isn't there an ApplicationInsights.config?

trans-unit.source: The .config file isn't installed by the Core API package, which is only used to configure telemetry collectors.
trans-unit.target: The .config file isn't installed by the Core API package, which is only used to configure telemetry collectors.

trans-unit.source: So you write your own code to set the instrumentation key and send telemetry.
trans-unit.target: So you write your own code to set the instrumentation key and send telemetry.

trans-unit.source: If you installed one of the other packages, you will have a .config file.
trans-unit.target: If you installed one of the other packages, you will have a .config file.

trans-unit.source: You can insert the instrumentation key there instead of setting it in code.
trans-unit.target: You can insert the instrumentation key there instead of setting it in code.

trans-unit.source: Could I use a different NuGet package?
trans-unit.target: Could I use a different NuGet package?

trans-unit.source: Yes, you could use the web server package (Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web), which would install collectors for a variety of collection modules such as performance counters.
trans-unit.target: Yes, you could use the web server package (Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web), which would install collectors for a variety of collection modules such as performance counters.

trans-unit.source: It would install a .config file, where you would put your instrumentation key.
trans-unit.target: It would install a .config file, where you would put your instrumentation key.

trans-unit.source: Use [ApplicationInsights.config to disable modules you don't want](app-insights-configuration-with-applicationinsights-config.md), such as the HTTP Request collector.
trans-unit.target: Use [ApplicationInsights.config to disable modules you don't want](app-insights-configuration-with-applicationinsights-config.md), such as the HTTP Request collector.

trans-unit.source: If you want to use the [log or trace collector packages](app-insights-asp-net-trace-logs.md), start with the web server package.
trans-unit.target: If you want to use the [log or trace collector packages](app-insights-asp-net-trace-logs.md), start with the web server package.

trans-unit.source: Insert telemetry calls
trans-unit.target: Insert telemetry calls

trans-unit.source: Create a `TelemetryClient` instance and then [use it to send telemetry][api].
trans-unit.target: Create a `TelemetryClient` instance and then [use it to send telemetry][api].

trans-unit.source: For example, in a Windows Forms application, you could write:
trans-unit.target: For example, in a Windows Forms application, you could write:

trans-unit.source: Use any of the [Application Insights API][api] to send telemetry.
trans-unit.target: Use any of the [Application Insights API][api] to send telemetry.

trans-unit.source: In Windows Desktop applications, no telemetry is sent automatically.
trans-unit.target: In Windows Desktop applications, no telemetry is sent automatically.

trans-unit.source: Typically you'd use:
trans-unit.target: Typically you'd use:

trans-unit.source: TrackPageView(pageName) on switching forms, pages, or tabs
trans-unit.target: TrackPageView(pageName) on switching forms, pages, or tabs

trans-unit.source: TrackEvent(eventName) for other user actions
trans-unit.target: TrackEvent(eventName) for other user actions

trans-unit.source: TrackMetric(name, value) in a background task to send regular reports of metrics not attached to specific events.
trans-unit.target: TrackMetric(name, value) in a background task to send regular reports of metrics not attached to specific events.

trans-unit.source: TrackTrace(logEvent) for [diagnostic logging][diagnostic]
trans-unit.target: TrackTrace(logEvent) for [diagnostic logging][diagnostic]

trans-unit.source: TrackException(exception) in catch clauses
trans-unit.target: TrackException(exception) in catch clauses

trans-unit.source: To make sure all telemetry is sent before closing the app, use `TelemetryClient.Flush()`.
trans-unit.target: To make sure all telemetry is sent before closing the app, use `TelemetryClient.Flush()`.

trans-unit.source: Normally, telemetry is batched and sent at regular intervals.
trans-unit.target: Normally, telemetry is batched and sent at regular intervals.

trans-unit.source: (Flush is recommended only if you are using just the core API.
trans-unit.target: (Flush is recommended only if you are using just the core API.

trans-unit.source: The web and device SDKs implement this behavior automatically.)
trans-unit.target: The web and device SDKs implement this behavior automatically.)

trans-unit.source: Context initializers
trans-unit.target: Context initializers

trans-unit.source: To see counts of users and sessions you can set the values on each `TelemetryClient` instance.
trans-unit.target: To see counts of users and sessions you can set the values on each `TelemetryClient` instance.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can use a context initializer to perform this addition for all clients:
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can use a context initializer to perform this addition for all clients:

trans-unit.source: Run your project
trans-unit.target: Run your project

trans-unit.source: [Run your application with F5](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/bg161304.aspx) and use it, so as to generate some telemetry.
trans-unit.target: [Run your application with F5](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/bg161304.aspx) and use it, so as to generate some telemetry.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, you'll see a count of the events that have been sent.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, you'll see a count of the events that have been sent.

trans-unit.source: See monitor data
trans-unit.target: See monitor data

trans-unit.source: Return to your application blade in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: Return to your application blade in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: The first events will appear in Diagnostic Search.
trans-unit.target: The first events will appear in Diagnostic Search.

trans-unit.source: Click Refresh after a few seconds if you're expecting more data.
trans-unit.target: Click Refresh after a few seconds if you're expecting more data.

trans-unit.source: If you used TrackMetric or the measurements parameter of TrackEvent, open [Metric Explorer][metrics] and open the Filters blade, where you'll see your metrics.
trans-unit.target: If you used TrackMetric or the measurements parameter of TrackEvent, open [Metric Explorer][metrics] and open the Filters blade, where you'll see your metrics.

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.target: [Track usage of your app][knowUsers]

trans-unit.target: [Capture and search diagnostic logs][diagnostic]
